title: Any free resources for learning python
content:
Freshie here.

I tried learning python from various sources -  youtube channels,W3 schools, etc 

but none of them seemed to have all the  relevant information compiled or the order in which they were discussed was different from the order in which they are taught to us in class . Plus  I suck  in  coding big time .So are there any  free resources relevant to our syllabus ,to atleast strengthen my basics before the ESA'S start

comments.body: Hackerrank can help, but look out other websites too

True referring this book 
Fundamentals of Python (First Programs) by Kenneth.A.Lambert ... 
Might help 
And try Hackerrank, it's great if you wanna learn basics. 
 realpython.com is also great!
This one is good for python
Sololearn is good as well, they have bite sized lessons and exercises
